page.title: 01Farm Land West of Dorchester
page.content: The area comprises essentilly undulating chalk farm land used for growing wheat and barley. This high ground is well suited for working by large machinery and in general is farmed by large co-operatives. The lower ground in the Winterbourne Valley is wetter and provides rich grass land for animal grazing. The valley is punctuated by the A35 the main route to Devon for holiday makers. The village of Winterbourne Abbas lies on a small stream which normally breaks in February - hence its name. There is no industry in the area but the village provides the essential requirements. It is at present expanding with new properties. Most villagers commute to the nearby towns for employment. Few large woods still exist due to intensive farming,
